I got to my feet as soon as I saw Kat start crying. I immediately embraced her; an awkward experience for both of us, if only because my breasts were noticeably bigger than hers. Maybe it was the shock wearing off, or maybe my hormones were out of whack; before I knew it, Kat and I were sharing a tearful embrace.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Breaking the News To Kat

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The two of us cried into each other’s shoulders for a few moments, until we stopped and grabbed some tissues. The two of us sat on the bed, with Kat looking at me. “I guess the two of us being a couple was fun while it lasted.”

I wasn’t ready to tell her that I was attracted to boys now; I figured seeing me with breasts and an hourglass figure was enough for now. There would time enough later to admit that I had a thing for big, strong guys. “I guess you’re right.”

Just then there was a knock on the door; after which I heard Mom say, “Marcus, honey; I’ve got some things for you.”
I got up from the bed and opened the door. “Thanks, Mom.”

Walking into the room, Mom looked at the two of us and said, “Are you two alright?”

“Not really, Mrs. Scott.” Standing next to me, Kat said, “My boyfriend’s becoming a girl.”

“Yeah, and it’s starting to sink in for me.”

“I can only imagine what you’re going through, sweetie.” Handing me a bag, Mom said, “I bought you some bras and panties; why don’t you try them on.”

Putting the bag on the bed, I dug through it until I found one of the bras. “Well what do you know, I’m a C cup.”

I could tell Kat was more than a little disturbed about everything, but she was putting on a strong face. “Let’s go to the bathroom, I’ll help you with the bra.”

Once we were in the bathroom, Kat helped me get the bra adjusted properly on my chest. Once she was finished, I looked at my reflection in the mirror. I had to admit my breasts looked nice in the bra; I just had a problem with the discomfort. “Will these get more comfortable the longer I wear it?”

“That hasn’t been my experience; let me tell you, I look forward to letting the girls out at the end of the day.”

I was a little embarrassed about trying the panties next; mostly because Kat was in the room while I did so. Once I put them on, I was immediately disappointed. Looking at Kat, I said, “I have less of a bulge than I would’ve liked.”

“Yeah, well your rear end more than makes up for it.”

Raising an eyebrow, I said, “Huh?”

“You have a nice badonkadonk.”

I looked at my rear in the mirror and realized Kat was right; my butt was much larger than it had been. I couldn’t help but blush.

******************************


Once I’d finished getting dressed, Mom told me that we’d be going over to Kat’s house. I wasn’t in the mood to do so, but I understand that it was necessary. After all, they would probably wonder where their daughter’s boyfriend had gone to.

The five of us were sitting in their living room; Kat’s parents just staring at me. After a moment, Mrs. Maddox said, “Well, this is unexpected.”

“Imagine what it’s like from my perspective.”

“Are you alright, Marcus?”

“It’s starting to sink in; I spent 18 years as a boy, but now...” I looked down at my hands; there was no doubt about it, my nails were longer and my hands more feminine. “I’ve got friends who’ve promised to help me; I just have to figure out what I need help with.”

“I know this must be a confusing time for you, Marcus.” Getting up, taking my hand in hers, Mrs. Maddox said, “If there’s anything we can help with, all you have to do is ask.”

“Thank you.” Starting to cry again, I said, “That means so much.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: My First Bra

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was pizza night once again; the only difference was, this time, I wasn’t quite as hungry as I usually was. I only managed to eat two slices before I was full; while Glenn ended up eating half the pizza by himself.

As I wiped some cheese off my mouth, Mom said, “Honey, there’s something I think we should discuss.”

“Oh?” confused, I said, “What’s that?”

“It’s about your name.” putting his pizza down, Dad said, “I don’t think you want to be the only girl in school with the Marcus, do you?”

I let out a little giggle; thinking about how weird that would be. “That would be kind of silly, wouldn’t it?”

“Your father and I named you Marcus when you were born.” Looking at me, Mom said, “We think it’s only fair that you decide what your new name should be.”

“I’m open to suggestions.”

I knew from the grin on Glenn’s face that he wasn’t going to take this seriously. I was proven right, when he said, “How about Ethel?”

“What do I look like, a 70-year-old woman?” glaring at him, I said, “I meant a serious suggestion."

“How about Marjorie?” looking at me, Dad said, “It was my mother’s name, and it sounds similar to Marcus.”

“Yeah, but I’d rather have a different name.” sighing, I said, “Sounding the same means you might call me Marcus by
accident.”

“That’s a good point.”

“How does Agatha sound?”

Fed up with Glenn’s suggestions, I looked at him and said, “How about helping?”

“What about my mother’s name, April?”

With a shake of my head, I said, “Yeah, I don’t think I’m an April”

“Way to burn Grandma, dude.”

“Don’t worry, sweetie, I’m sure Grandma Cassidy will understand.”

A smile on my face, I said, “Hey, that sounds good.”

"What does?"

“Your maiden name, Cassidy.”

“Cassidy Scott?” smiling, Mom said, “That does sound good.”

“Then we can use Marjorie for my middle name.”

“Then it’s settled.” Looking at me, Dad said, “Welcome to the world, Cassidy Marjorie Scott.”

And just like that, they never called me Marcus again.

******************************


That night, as I walked into my room to go to bed, I closed the door and got undressed. I quickly realized Kat was right, it felt so good to be out of my bra. After cleaning out my underwear drawer, I put away my bras and panties.

Mom had also purchased some girlier pajamas for me to wear; mostly lounge pants and tops, but there were several nighties. They wouldn’t have been my first choice since they were on the pink side, but they fit me. My boyish looked funny coming out of them, but I knew would change soon enough.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: My New Name

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
When I woke up the next morning, my feet no longer looked funny coming out of a set of girl's pajamas. Like my hands, they had become dainty and feminine. Not much of Marcus left anymore, I thought.

This was verified when I took off my pajamas in the bathroom. Between my legs, I was equipped like a 5-year-old. I wasn't confident, either in my aiming skills or in my ability to avoid wetting my fingers, so I sat down, pointing my little man down with one hand.

With that taken care of, I took a shower. I saw that Mom had picked up some body wash, shampoo, and conditioner for me, so I gave them a try. My skin seemed more sensitive, tingling pleasurably with the body wash. My shoulder-length hair felt good with the shampoo and conditioner, too. The drawback was, it took forever to dry my hair, even with a hair dryer.

Finally, I was done. I wrapped a towel around my waist, and headed for my bedroom.

I walked right into Mom, who pushed me back into the bathroom. "You are not traipsing around with your breasts hanging out, young lady," she said. "What if your brother had been out there?"

That thought scared me. "Sorry, Mom," I said. "I guess I wasn't thinking."

Mom showed me the ladylike way to tie a towel around myself, and I went to my room.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Morning

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Will you be okay on your own?" Mom asked. She and Dad were going to set up my new identity with the school board, while Glenn was spending the day with his friends.

"I'll be fine, Mom," I replied. And I would be: I could leave the house in the event of an emergency. I could fend for myself. I wasn't an infant or an invalid.

I was just turning into a girl.

I had just made myself a sandwich when the doorbell rang. It was Kat. "Wow," she said, "you really are turning into a girl, aren't you, Marc?"

"Did you doubt me?" I asked. "By the way, my name's Cassidy now. It was Mom's maiden name."

"Cassidy. It suits you. I knew you were turning into a girl, but you still had Marcus's face yesterday. You hadn't noticed?"

She showed me my face on her phone. It was true: in the hours since this morning, my face had become more feminine. "Wow. Nobody who saw this face would think I was once a boy."

"I came over for two reasons, Cassidy. The first is, I thought I'd invite you to have a sleepover at my house. Sort of give you a crash course in being a girl. Besides, when we're in high school, nobody would believe you'd never been to a sleepover."

"Sounds fun. I'll be there. What's the second reason?"

"Mom wants to take you shopping tomorrow. I know your mom was going to, but my mom might be willing to pick up some things that your mom might not think of for you. What do you say?"

"If it saves us money, I'm sure Mom will go for it. Four years of customizing everything for someone in a wheelchair, the costs really add up."

"Okay, see you tonight." She hugged me. "Are you shorter? We're practically the same height."

"Dr. Sheppard said I might not get above five-six. I guess I'm going under that for a while."

Kat left, and I went back to my lunch.

I had just finished my sandwich when the doorbell rang again. Thinking it was Kat again, I didn't look before opening the door. That was how I wound up face to chest with Eric.

"Hey, little lady," he said. "I'm looking for Marcus. Is he home?"

I didn't want to explain what happened to me to Eric, so I thought quickly. Luckily, I was always able to think faster than he did. "I'm afraid he's still in the hospital," I said. "I'm his cousin, Cassidy."

"Well, the next time you see him, let him know his old buddy Eric is looking to see him."

"I'll be sure to tell him," I said, but I was thinking, Why didn't you come visit me in the hospital, like Kat did?

He left,and I breathed a sigh of relief. Maybe it was the height difference between us, but I wasn't 100% sure whether he was looking at my face or my breasts.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: My Day

1111111111112.content:
Allison stood up as I approached the bed; giving me a strange look as I went past. “That’s funny; I didn’t realize until just now, but you’re shorter than the last time I saw you.”

I had no idea what Allison was talking about, and the expression on my face said as much. “What are you talking about?”

Grabbing my arm, Allison gently pulled me back into the bathroom. “The last time I saw you, before my trip, you were a good 3 inches taller than me.” Standing the two of us next to each other, she said, “Now we’re about the same height; I might even be a smidge taller than you.”

As I looked at the reflection in the mirror, I quickly realized Allison was right. Now I wasn’t that tall to begin with, no more than 5’9” at most, so to see that I had suddenly shrunk was disconcerting. “Okay, that’s weird; Dr. Sheppard didn’t say anything about me shrinking.” Concerned, I said, “What should I do?”

“You were given an experimental medicine, Marcus; I’d get in touch with Dr. Sheppard immediately.” Looking at me, she said, “If he’s planning to take this procedure public, he should know of any unforeseen issues.”

“I’m pretty sure he’s still working here at the hospital, I’ll have him paged.” With a sigh, I said, “Could you call my folks and tell them?”

“Of course.” Hugging me, Allison said, “It’s going to be okay, Marcus.”

“Thanks, Ally.”
1111111111112.title: You're Shorter

11111111111121.content:
Calling Dr. Sheppard turned out to be a wise call; because by the time he and my folks got to the room, I’d shrunk another two inches. I was now no taller than a 10-year-old. Everyone was understandably shocked when they walked into the room; seeing me sitting at the foot of the bed in a hospital gown that was now too big for me.

“What’s happening to me, Dr. Sheppard?” worried, I said, “You never said anything about me getting shorter.”

“I’m as confused as you are, Marcus; this never happened in any of the tests.” Looking at me, he said, “If it’s alright with you, I’d like to run some tests.”

“Go right ahead; the sooner you can undo the better.” Sighing, I said, “Starting high school again is going to be awkward enough, I’d rather not be the shortest member of the freshman class.”

Retrieving a syringe from a drawer, Dr. Sheppard prepared to take some blood. “I assure you that won’t happen, Marcus. I’ll send this to the lab; we should know more in an hour or so.”

**********************


The next hour seemed to drag by; as everyone, including me, patiently awaited the results of the test. Allison and Mom were in the corner, talking about the proposal, while Dad was using the bathroom. Glenn walked back into the room with a glass of water; as he handed it to me, he said, “How are you doing, bro?”

“How do you think I’m doing, Glenn?” taking the water, I said, “I get the use of my legs back, but I’ve shrunk to the size of a 10-year-old boy.”

“I wonder how Kat is going to feel; dating someone that’s practically the same height as her.” Seeing the dumbfounded look on my face, Glenn said, “Don’t look so surprised, I overheard you telling her you’d like to go out with her at some point.”

“You’re not going to make fun of me, are you?”

“Why would I do that?” looking at me, Glenn said, “Kat’s a good looking girl; who am I to say you can’t date her.”
“Phew. I was worried you’d say it was weird”

“It is a little weird; I mean, she’s practically our little sister.” Pausing, Glenn said, “But if neither of you has a problem with that, then I’d say go for it.”

Another few minutes went by before Dr. Sheppard entered the room again. He was holding a tablet in his hands and had a grim look on his face. The look told me that he didn’t have good news. “What’s wrong with me, Doc?”

“It seems that the series of injections had an unintended side effect.” Looking at me and my family, Dr. Sheppard said, “It did repair Marcus’ spine as planned; but instead of making him a 13-year-old again, it’s making him even younger.”

Everyone in the room made an audible gasp. Looking at Dr. Sheppard, worried, I said, “How much younger?”

“If my tests are correct; by this time tomorrow, you’ll be _____.”
11111111111121.title: Consulting with Dr. Sheppard

111111111111212.content:
"A toddler? This is a nightmare I'm having, right? Just a big, scary dream. And, when I wake up, I'll be my 13-year-old self, right?"

Dr. Sheppard shook his head. "I'm sorry, Marcus. You're no longer 13. You're 10. And you're still getting younger."

I looked up at Glenn. Way up at him. He really was the big brother now. "It... it wasn't supposed to be like this."

"I know, bro."

"None of us expected something like this," Dr. Sheppard said. He took a breath. "Among other things, you'll need a new wardrobe. I'll pay for it, out of my own pocket. And I'll start an account for you, to help fund your education."

"For now, Doctor," Dad said, "we'd like to be alone."

"Of course," he said, and left my room.

The words filled my mind. A toddler. Forget junior high, it was day care for me. Video games? More like blocks. And then there's the bathroom, assuming I don't wind up back in diapers.

Glenn cleared his throat. "What are you going to tell Kat?"

Kat! She had had a crush on me since forever, and she was looking forward to us dating. Fat chance of that happening now. I'll be too young for her, now, instead of the other way around. "I can't talk to her just now," I said. "Maybe later."

"You might not want to make it too much later," Glenn said.

I nodded. Who knew how long I'd be able to speak to her?
111111111111212.title: A Toddler

1111111111112121.content:
I must’ve fallen asleep at some point after getting that unwanted news; because when I woke up, I quickly realized I was no longer in my hospital room. I tried to look around at my surroundings but found that my body wasn’t responding the way it should. Oh no; please don’t let me be paralyzed again.

It took some effort but I managed to turn my head enough to see a baby lying in a crib next to me. I soon realized where I was, when I discovered that I was in a similar crib – I was in the hospital’s nursery. Oh god, I’m a baby again. I tried to speak in a desperate attempt to get some attention, but found the only noise I could make was a whimper.

I quickly grew frustrated and did the only thing I could do – I started crying. I don’t know how long I cried for, but soon enough a nurse appeared above me. “Hello little one.” Lifting me up, she said, “Are you hungry?”

No, I’m not hungry! I’m a teenager, not a baby! But the only thing I could do was keep crying. After a few minutes of this, the nurse placed me back in the crib and wheeled me out of the room. Where is she taking me?

I soon had my answer when I was wheeled into a hospital room. I could hear voices but had trouble determining who they were. After a moment, I heard a voice I could identify – my mom’s. “Is he alright?”

For some reason her voice had a calming effect on me, and I slowly stopped crying. As the nurse picked me up, she said, “I think he’s probably a little hungry; after all, he’s been through quite an ordeal.”

You can say that again. I figured the nurse would hand me off to mom so she could give me a bottle. So imagine my reaction when I saw Mom lying in a hospital bed. She looked different; like she’d gained weight since I last saw her. As the nurse handed me off to her, Mom said, “Its okay sweetie, Mommy’s here.”

My confusion turned to horror when, instead of reaching for a bottle, Mom took out one of her breasts. Oh god no. I was powerless to stop her as she slowly guided me towards the exposed nipple. The memory of me latching on and breast feeding was one I’d give anything to forget. The fact that I was doing so without even thinking was very disturbing.

So there I was, being breastfed by my mom, when Glenn appeared in my line of sight. I focused on him as he looked at me and said, “I bet that wheelchairs looking pretty good right about now.”

Suddenly everything went dark. When I could finally see again, I was relieved to find that I was back in my hospital room. I did get a little worried, however, when I saw Mom standing over me. Much to my relief, she simply looked down on me and said, “Marcus, sweetie, are you alright?”

I was quite relieved when I found I was able to talk. “Yeah, I’m fine.” Looking at her, I said, “Why does my body feel weird?”

“I’m afraid your...regression is complete; you’re now approximately 14 months old.”

As Mom reached down to pick me up, I wanted nothing more than for her to be wrong. Alas, that wasn’t meant to be; while holding me in her arms, she turned to face the mirror. Staring back at me, clear as day, was the reflection of a horrified looking 14-month-old baby. Before I knew what was happening, I started crying.
1111111111112121.title: A Nightmare

11111111111121211.content:
"After you fell asleep," Mom said, after I calmed down, "your regression accelerated. Dr. Sheppard thinks that may be why you fell asleep: the process must be exhausting. You were at 14 months for an hour before he officially declared it complete."

"Where are Daddy and Glenn?" I asked, then winced at my use of a word I hadn't used since I was little the first time.

"I sent them home. I figured you didn't need everybody around to show you how small you'd become."

"I guess it could be worse," I said. "I dreamed I was a baby. Apparently it was the first time, because you were in a hospital bed. You... you started... I need brain bleach."

"Well, if I was fumbling as much as you were, I'd say I was impressed with your recall. And yes, you'll be in a stroller for a while, but you know you'll get out of it, just like you did before." She gave a snort. "If you'll forgive me for sounding a bit selfish, I must say, I'm looking forward to the years ahead."

"Why?"

"Well, I got to watch you grow up, and, now, I get to see you grow up all over again. That's got to be a world first." She kissed me, then lay me in bed. "Now, I'm afraid I have bad news for you."

I braced myself for the worst. "Go ahead."

"Somebody in this room just made a present. And it wasn't me."

I sighed, and resigned myself to the indignity of the first of many diaper changes.
11111111111121211.title: Continue

111111111111212111.content:
The next morning, I was examined, not by Dr. Sheppard, but by a pediatrician.

When the examination was over, the doctor said, "Well, Mrs. Scott, your son is a perfectly healthy 14-month-old boy."

"Sounds great," I said, "except I'm supposed to be 13."

"You may want to put a little more effort into keeping incognito," he said. "Children your age aren't supposed to talk."

"I did this so I could walk again, Doc. Now, not only can't I walk, I've lost control of my bladder and bowels. Forgive me for having a few things to say about it, and be glad I've got control over my tongue."

He let what I said slide, and turned back to Mom and Dad. "Since he's healthy, we can release him into your custody, assuming you have an appropriate seat for your car."

"They do," Dr. Sheppard said, and handed Dad a seat.

The pediatrician nodded. "Alright, then. Why don't we start the paperwork, Doctor?"

Shortly after the two doctors left, Kat walked in. "How's my brand-new boyfriend doing?" she asked, then looked around. "Where's Marcus?"

"Sit down, Kat," Mom said.

Kat sat down.

"Kat," Mom said, "this is Marcus."

"Don't try to kid me, Mrs. Scott. Marcus is my age now, not a baby."

"It was an unforeseen side effect," Dad said. "Marcus kept getting younger until he was 14 months old."

"Do you honestly expect me to believe that?"

"What do you want me to do, Kat?" I asked. "Check your closet for monsters?"

Kat got up and walked over to me. "M-Marc?"

I nodded. "It's me."

She passed out.
111111111111212111.title: The Next Morning

1111111111112121111.content:
Alerted by my mom’s yelling, a doctor came running into the room. “What’s wrong?”

I wanted to respond, but remembered what the doctor said about blending in – I had to act like the baby I appeared to be. While Mom cradled me in her arms, Dad said, “She fainted; I think she hit her head.”

After an examination revealed a small bump on Kat’s head, the doctor returned with an ice pack and instructions to call for him if things changed. Once the doctor left the room, Mom slowly walked over to the bed; giving me a glimpse of Kat as she lay there.

As I stared at her, I started to whimper a little bit. Damn this immature body. Looking up at Mom, I said, “Is Kat going to be alright?”

“Of course, sweetie.” In a soothing manner, Mom said, “You heard the doctor; it’s just a mild bump.”

Kat suddenly started to groan; slowly opening her eyes and looking around the room. “W-What happened?”

“You fainted, Kat.” Handing her the ice pack, Dad said, “The doctor said you have a minor bump but otherwise you’re fine.”

As Kat placed the ice pack on her head, she looked at me and said, “I swear you said that baby was Marcus.”

Looking at her, worried that she’d faint again, I said, “It is me, Kat.”

“That’s really you, Marcus?” A dumbfounded look on her face, Kat said, “H-How is that even possible?”

As Mom turned so I could see Kat better, I said, “Dr. Sheppard doesn’t know what caused this, but he’s working on figuring it out.” Looking at her, I said, “If it helps, I’m a perfectly healthy 14-month-old.”

“Is there any chance this can be reversed?”

“He won’t know until he figures out what went wrong.” Sighing, I said, “I’m stuck like this in the meantime.”

Suddenly everyone in the room, including me, caught a whiff of a putrid smell. I immediately knew what it was, but was embarrassed to say it with Kat in the room – I’d soiled my diaper. Unfortunately, Mom didn’t have any qualms about being subtle. Looking at Kat, she said, “Kat, would you mind holding Marcus? I need to change his diaper.”
1111111111112121111.title: Repercussions

11111111111121211111.content:
Kat and I were left alone after Mom changed my diaper. Holding me in her arms, Kat sat down in the chair and looked at me. “I can’t believe this is happening, Marcus; how can something like this be possible?”

“I was chatting with Allison when she noticed that I’d shrunk a few inches.” Squirming a little bit, I said, “By the time Dr. Sheppard and my folks got here, I was the size of a 10-year-old. The changes continued while I was asleep, I woke up looking like this.”

“This has to be some cruel cosmic joke.” Tearing up, Kat said, “I was so excited by the thought of us dating, but now you’re a
toddler.”

“Dr. Sheppard said there’s a chance this can be reversed, so we could still have a chance at dating.” Sighing, I said, “In the meantime, I’ll have to pretend I’m really a 14-month-old; which shouldn’t be too hard, seeing as I can’t walk and I’m forced to use a diaper.”

“You have my word that I’ll do everything I can to help you, Marcus.” Leaning down, Kat kissed me on the forehead, “Toddler or not, I still love you.”

Hearing Kat telling me that she loved me brought a smile to my face. “I love you too, Kat.”

Kat started to chuckle a little as she looked at me. Seeing my perplexed look, she said, “You have a really cute smile, Marcus.”

I wanted to say Kat was crazy, since I only had four teeth, but decided not to. Looking at her, I simply said, “If you say so, Kat.”

The two of us just stayed like that for a while, Kat just holding me in her arms. I don’t know what it was, maybe the feeling of her heartbeat, but I felt safe in Kat’s arms. After a while, I started to feel drowsy, and I soon fell asleep in her arms.
11111111111121211111.title: Alone With Kat

111111111111212111111.content:
I must’ve been asleep for a while; because when I was rudely awakened by a loud noise, I quickly realized I wasn’t in the hospital anymore. I was momentarily confused by my surroundings until I realized I was in a car seat facing towards the rear of the car.

“Is anyone there?” looking around, I said, “What’s going on?”

The sound of an opening door grabbed my attention; I turned to find Mom standing just outside the car. “Did you have a nice nap, sweetie?”

I looked behind Mom and caught a glimpse of the Wal-Mart sign in the distance. “Why are we at Wal-Mart?”

“We needed to get some things for you; a crib, high chair, etc.” smiling, Mom said, “You must’ve been tired because you slept the entire time we were in the store.”

“How long was I even asleep? The last thing I remember was talking with Kat.”

“That was almost two hours ago.” With a chuckle, Mom said, “You looked adorable, asleep in Kat’s arms.”

I was about to say something when I spotted Dad and Glenn pushing two fully loaded shopping carts through the parking lot. It didn’t take a genius to realize what was in the boxes; sure Mom told me what they’d bought, but seeing the boxes in person just served as a painful reminder that I was now a baby.

It took all of 10 minutes to get everything into the back of the car; Glenn got in the back seat next to me. Looking at me, he said,
“Hey bro, how was your nap?”

“Not that bad, considering I’m a toddler.” Looking at him, seeing a bottle of soda in his hands, I said, “Could I have a drink of that soda, I’m kind of thirsty.”

“Oh no, Marcus; you can’t have soda at your age.” Peaking over from the trunk, Mom looked at Glenn and said, “Glenn, there’s some pre-made bottles of formula in the bag behind Marcus.”

As Glenn reached for the bag, I said, “Hell no, I’m not drinking from a bottle!”

“You’re 13 months old, Marcus; it comes with the territory.” With a stern look on her face, Mom said, “Also please watch your language; I don’t want to explain why my 13-month-old is talking, let alone swearing.”

Glenn had retrieved one of the bottles by that point. Handing it to me, he said, “Here you go, bro.”

I looked at the bottle in disgust; there was no way I was going to drink from that. After a moment, however, my resolve started to dissipate; soon enough, to my embarrassment, I was drinking from the bottle. What made the situation worse – I was enjoying it.
111111111111212111111.title: Waking Up

1111111111112121111111.content:
Barely an hour had passed since we got home from the hospital, but already Dad and Glenn had managed to baby proof most the house. After they’d finished baby-proofing the bathroom, they moved on to my bedroom; where they would change it from a teenager’s room to that of a toddler’s.

While all that was going on, I was strapped into a baby walker downstairs. I couldn’t help but feel like fate was playing a cruel joke on me; the whole reason I’d gone through with the treatments was to get the use of my legs back, only now I’d been regressed to an age where I couldn’t walk even if I wanted to.

Mom had just put me in a fresh diaper, so I was set loose once again. I was rolling around downstairs, checking out the work Dad and Glenn had done. They’d put corner protectors on everything I could possibly reach, baby proof locks on the cabinets, and a retractable gate across the basement door. Okay, maybe that last one was a good idea.

A noise in the kitchen attracted my attention, so I decided to see what it was. Thanks in large part to my short baby legs; it took me a few moments to traverse the eight feet from the basement door to the kitchen. But once I was there, I saw Mom moving some cans from a bag to a shelf in the pantry. I caught a look at one of the cans as she stacked it on the shelf; it was baby food.
“Mom, do I really have to eat that stuff?”

“I’m afraid so, Marcus.” Continuing to work, she said, “Since you’ve only got four teeth you're not able to eat the same food that you used to.”

“But that stuff tastes disgusting!”

“It’s the only thing you’re able to eat at your age, sweetie,” looking at me, she said, “There’s going to be a period of adjustment for all of us; I just ask that you remain patient.”

“What’s there for you to adjust to?” getting at annoyed, I said, “I’m the one who got turned into a damn toddler.”

“Watch your mouth, Marcus.” Sighing, Mom said, “Everyone will have to adjust to your new condition, just like we did after your accident.”

“What about the all the baby proofing Dad and Glenn have been doing?” looking up at her, trying my best to sound serious, I said,
“You do realize I’m only a toddler physically, right?”

“If we have people over, and they see you roaming around, they'll expect to see precautions against you getting into anything you shouldn't. Just like how I don't want you cursing.”

“Okay, I guess that’s fair.”

Mom was about to go back to work on the food when Glenn walked into the kitchen. Seeing the two of us, he said, “We’ve got Marcus’ room all set up if you guys want to come upstairs.”
1111111111112121111111.title: At Home

11111111111121211111111.content:
In retrospect, I should have realized how extensive the changes to my room would’ve been. My first clue that something was amiss was when Mom carried me upstairs; I saw several boxes of my things lining the hallway. Please don’t give that stuff away. Then I saw my bed frame, and mattress, leaning against the wall just outside my room.

I prepared myself for what was sure to come, but even that wasn’t going to be enough. Glenn led us into my room, where I saw what they had done. Now my room wasn’t all that big, it was slightly smaller than Glenn’s, but seeing how empty it was without my bed, my desk, and my TV was just shocking.

Situated against the wall where my bed had been was a brand new crib, with one of those spinning mobiles attached to it. Oh god, it’s like they forgot I’m still mentally me. Next, I saw a motorized swing in the corner, along with what looked like every stuffed animal Glenn and I ever had growing up. Okay, that’s a nice touch.

Dad, in the process of lifting a changing table onto my dresser, said, “What do you think, Marcus?”

I tried my best to come off as being incredulous, but I couldn’t pull it off in my current condition. “It’s almost like this room never belonged to a teenager.”

“We had considered setting up your crib in our room, but we thought you wouldn’t like that.”

“Damn right I wouldn’t!” getting annoyed, I said, “You guys did all this without even asking me what I wanted.”

“Come on, Marcus.” Looking at me, worried about my increasingly poor attitude, Glenn said, “We’re just trying to take care of you.”

“I’m 18 years old; I don’t need you to take care of me!”

At that point, my emotions grew beyond what I could control, and I started not only crying but kicking as well. As far as anyone was concerned, I was just a 14 month old having a tantrum; which only served to get me even more riled up.

My cries echoed through the nearly empty room; until Mom managed to get Glenn’s attention. “Glenn, there’s an unopened package of pacifiers in the bathroom; go get one of them.”

Glenn quickly ran out of the room while I continued crying, at one point I even kicked Mom in the mouth. Glenn returned about a minute later, pacifier in hand. “Here you go, Mom.”

Taking the pacifier, Mom looked at me and said, “I didn’t want to do this, Marcus; but you aren’t giving me much choice.” Placing the pacifier in my mouth, she said, “If you’re going to act like a toddler, then we’re going to treat you like one.”

The feeling of the pacifier in my mouth was disturbing, but it did have a surprising effect on me. I slowly calmed down and stopped crying; until I was quietly sucking on the pacifier. This is so embarrassing, but it does feel right.

I was content to suck on the pacifier as Dad appeared in my field of vision. Looking at Mom, he said, “Perhaps we should let him lie down; he’s had a rough day.”

“I suppose you’re right.” Looking down at me, Mom said, “Hopefully when you wake up, you’ll be in a better mood.”

My eyelids had started to droop at that point; as Mom gently lowered me into the crib, tucked me in under a blanket, and put a stuffed giraffe in my hands. The last thing I remembered before falling asleep was seeing Glenn and my parents looking down at me.
11111111111121211111111.title: Baby's First Tantrum

111111111111212111111111.content:
It was almost night time when I woke up again; the last ray of sunlight was bouncing off the far wall. Even though I was on my back, I knew that I was alone in the room. Memories from earlier came back as I lay there; from what had been done to my room, to the subsequent temper tantrum.

It took some doing, but I managed to roll over onto my stomach. After a moment on my stomach, using the sides of the crib, I managed to pull myself up to a standing position. My legs wobbled a little bit, but I was confident that I wasn’t going anywhere.

I caught a glimpse of myself in a nearby mirror, and I was taken aback by what I saw. Wearing nothing but a diaper, and with a pacifier in my mouth, there was no way I’d be mistaken for anything but a toddler. This is so humiliating; I’m supposed to be in High School, not diapers.

Suddenly the bedroom door opened and Mom walked into the room. She must’ve been watching me through a camera because she wasn’t surprised to see that I was awake. “That was quite a tantrum you had earlier, Marcus.” Walking over to the crib, Mom said, “You aren’t doing yourself any favors, acting like that. If you act like a baby, we’re going to treat you like one.”

Spitting the pacifier out, I said, “Sorry Mom, I-I guess I kind of lost it.”

“I have a bruised lip that would agree with you.” Picking me up from the crib, Mom said, “Let’s go downstairs, it’s time for dinner.”

I tried to get excited about that, as Mom carried me downstairs, but I quickly remembered what that meant – canned baby food for me, while they got to eat regular food.
111111111111212111111111.title: Waking Up

1111111111112121111111111.content:
Mom carried me into the kitchen and placed me in the high chair. After placing a bib around my neck, she sat down and looked at me, “Now Marcus, as I explained earlier, you can longer have any of the food you normally would.” Reaching for two jars of baby food on the table, Mom said, “You have a choice between chicken & gravy or mashed carrots.”

I looked at the jars for a moment; neither of them looked very appetizing. After a minute, I looked at Mom and said, “Can I please have what you guys are having?”

“I’m afraid not, sweetie.” Sighing, Mom said, “I know it’s frustrating; but, given time, I think you’ll get used to it.”

I crossed my arms in an attempt to look tough; only I’m sure it didn’t have the effect I’d intended. “If I can’t have what you’re having, then I’m not eating.”

Getting up, Mom went over to the fridge and returned with a bottle. “Okay then, if that’s how you want to do this.” With the bottle in one hand and the jars of baby food in the other, Mom said, “Either you have the baby food, or I’ll give you a bottle.”
1111111111112121111111111.title: Downstairs

11111111111121211111111112.content:
While neither option was appealing to me, I figured that the baby food was the lesser of two evils. With my arms still crossed, I silently pointed towards the baby food. Putting the bottle down, for the moment, Mom turned back to me. “Okay, now which flavor would you like?”

“They both sound disgusting.” Sighing, I said, “Why don’t you just choose.”

Grabbing on the jars, Mom said, “Fine, chicken & gravy it is then.”

I watched, hesitantly, as Mom opened the jar of food. I can’t believe my life’s come to this. Dipping the spoon into the jar, she was about to feed it to me when the phone suddenly started ringing. As she got up from the table, Mom called out, “Glenn, could you come in here!”

God, please no! Before I could protest, Glenn came running into the kitchen. “Yeah, Mom?”

As Mom went to answer the phone, she said, “Could you do me a favor, and feed your brother?”

Glenn quickly obliged and sat down across from me. Grabbing the jar, and spoon, he looked at me and said, “Is widdle baby hungry?”

It was bad enough that I was in this situation; I didn’t need Glenn teasing me about it. But, as he looked at me with a goofy smile, I decided to have a little fun with him. I thought back to the few times I had to help feed him, back when he was a baby. He was one of the fussiest babies that I’d ever seen; more than a few times I had to sample the food just to get him to eat it.

That was when I got an idea; I would pretend to be fussy and refuse to eat, in the hopes that he would eat some of the food. The plan started perfectly; every time he would bring the spoon near my mouth, I would do my best to avoid it. After a few failed attempts, Glenn was starting to get frustrated. “Mom! Marcus won’t eat his dinner.”

“You have to be patient, Glenn; he’s still getting used to this.” Sighing, covering the phone’s mouthpiece, Mom said, “Why don’t you try eating some it yourself; that always worked when you were a baby.”

Bingo. A smile formed on my mouth as Glenn slowly, but surely, brought the spoon up to his mouth. I started to giggle as he ate a spoonful of food; only to stop when he immediately spat it out in disgust – all over my face.

I don’t know why it happened; maybe I was tired or maybe I was just surprised. But before Glenn even had a chance to apologize, I started crying.
11111111111121211111111112.title: I Gave In

111111111111212111111111121.content:
Mom came in. "I'm glad that call wasn't too important," she said. "What happened here?"

"I tried the baby food, like you said," Glenn replied. "It tasted like dog sh - "

"Language," Mom said.

"I mean, it tasted terrible, and I spit it out. That's when he started crying."

"Here, son," Mom said, "let's get you cleaned up." She took out a moist towelette and wiped the spit-out baby food off my face. "Better?"

"I guess," I said.

"Good. Now, where were we? Oh, yes, feeding you." She brought the spoon to my lips.

Sending that I wouldn't be able to trick Mom the same way, I opened my mouth, and instantly regretted it.

As Mom scooped up another spoonful of baby food, I asked, "What's wrong with me?"

"Nothing, sweetie," she said. "Apart from turning into a 14-month-old, you're perfectly healthy. Otherwise, you'd still be in the hospital." In went the spoon.

"That's not what I mean," I said. "A little spit shouldn't have made me cry. And I shouldn't have cried over my old stuff. So what's wrong with me?"

"Hmmm. Well , you know how you've lost physical maturity?"

"I've noticed it once or twice."

"Well, maybe, at the same time, your emotional maturity has taken a hit." She pointed at my head. "Intellectually, you know what's worth getting upset over and what isn't." Then she pointed at my heart. "But in here, it hurts like it was a direct attack on you. You can't lash out physically at whatever upsets you, so you break down and cry. Does that make sense?"

I nodded.

"But there's good news, too. If we can engage your intelligence, your emotions won't notice what upsets them, and you can be okay."

"Do you think so?"

She held up an empty jar of chicken and gravy baby food. "You tell me."

For dessert, Mom mushed up a scoop of vanilla ice cream and fed it to me.
111111111111212111111111121.title: Continue

1111111111113.content:
Allison stood up as I approached the bed, giving me a strange look as I went past. "That's funny," she said. I didn't realize until just now, but I think you've gotten more muscular since I saw you last. Have you been working out?"

"Oh, go on," I replied, "you're just saying that."

"I promise you, I'm quite serious," she said. "Leaving aside the fact that I'm a lesbian, do you really think I'm the kind of person who would hit on a 13-year-old?"

Those were both good points. I turned back around and went back to the bathroom, shutting the door behind me.

Taking off my hospital gown, I saw that Allison had been telling the truth: my muscles were a bit bigger, and my body fat substantially less. I had picked up a bit of a spare tire over four and a half years of sitting down; now, I looked as physically fit as an Olympic swimmer. I tied my gown back on, opened the door, and went back to my bed.

As I climbed back into bed, I said to Allison, "You're right. I am a bit more muscular. I had to increase my protein intake before the procedure, maybe that's why."

"I suppose that could be it," Allison said. "Well, congratulations on getting out of the wheelchair. I'll see you and your family again soon. Take care, now."

"You, too, Allison," I replied, and we both waved goodbye.

After Allison left, something occurred to me: what with two bathroom trips in a matter of minutes, I had walked more than I had since the accident. Four and a half years ago.

So why wasn't I the least bit tired?
1111111111113.title: You're More Muscular

11111111111131.content:
As unusual as this development was, I decided it wasn’t worth telling Dr. Sheppard; unless something changed. In the meantime, I decided that growing bigger muscles was a good thing. It certainly wouldn’t harm my relationship with Kat; what girl wouldn’t want to date a strong, muscular guy.

With nothing to do and no one to talk to, I became bored rather quickly. I tried watching TV but found that I was incredibly antsy. After a while, I gave up and climbed out of bed. With my phone in hand, I returned to the bathroom and closed the door.

I know it might seem shallow, but I really wanted to take pictures of my new body. I took off my hospital gown and started flexing a little bit. Damn, I look good. I did that for a few minutes until I heard footsteps on the other side of the door. That was quickly followed by the sound of Glenn said, “Marcus, where are you?”

“I’m in the bathroom.”

Putting my phone down, I went to the door and walked outside; without realizing I hadn’t put the robe back on. I didn’t realize my mistake until Glenn said, “What the hell happened to you?”
11111111111131.title: It's Probably Nothing

1111111111114.content:
Allison stood up as I approached the bed; giving me a strange look as I went past. “That’s funny; I didn’t notice it until just now, but have you gotten taller?”

I had no idea what Allison was talking about, and the expression on my face said as much. “What are you talking about?”

Grabbing my arm, Allison gently pulled me back into the bathroom. “The last time I saw you, before my trip, we were about the same height.” Standing the two of us next to each other, she said, “Now it looks like you’re good two inches taller.”

As I looked at the reflection in the mirror, I quickly realized Allison was right. Allison and I were both about 5’9” but it now looked like I was just under 6’ tall. “Okay, that’s weird; Dr. Sheppard didn’t say anything about me getting taller.” Confused, I looked at Allison and said, “What should I do, Ally?”

“It may just be a sudden growth spurt, but it could be something to do with the medicine you were given.” Looking at me, she said, “Just to be safe, I suggest you get in touch with him.”

“I don’t have his number, but I think he’s still got an office here at the hospital. Do you think you could page him for me?” pausing, I said, “I’ll call my folks and have them come over here.”

“Of course, Marcus.” Hugging me, Allison said, “It’s probably nothing to worry about, but it’s good that we’re checking to be sure.”
1111111111114.title: You're Taller

11111111111141.content:
When Dr. Sheppard walked into my room, he saw immediately what Allison was talking about. "I'm glad your friend called me in, Marcus," he said. "This is definitely something we should look at."

"Do you think it could be serious?" I asked. "And does my voice sound different to anyone else?"

"It's a little deeper," the doctor confirmed. "Let's run some tests, and see if we can figure this out."

******************************


I went through a battery of tests, even more than when I was being considered for the procedure. By the time I was done, I had grown to 6', 1", as tall as Dad.

Finally, Dr. Sheppard came back. His facial expression alone told us that this was serious. "What is it, Doctor?" Mom asked.

"Marcus has had an unforeseen reaction to the treatment," he replied. "After the procedure made him four years younger, this effect has reversed itself, and he is now aging rapidly."

"Are you sure, Doc?" I asked.

"I'm quite certain, Marcus. Right now, you look and sound like you're headed for your senior year in college. And I don't think this is quite finished."

"How long is this going to go on?" Mom asked.

"I think he'll age into his mid-20s," was the response. "We'll know for sure later on."

I had become an adult, without the education and experience that's supposed to go along with it.
11111111111141.title: A Consult

111111111111411.content:
Dr. Sheppard was right about the changes slowing down. I’m not sure how I knew but, after about an hour, I felt that the changes had stopped. I had no way of knowing how old I was now, but I was no longer a teenager.

I was in the bathroom, looking at myself in the mirror when Dad walked into the room. As he stood next to me, I could easily see a striking resemblance between the two of us. If he’d been younger, we probably would’ve passed for twins.

“I’m scared Dad.” Looking at him, I said, “What am I supposed to do now?”

“I don’t know, Marcus; but we’ll get through it together.” Placing a hand on my shoulder, he said, “But on the plus side, you’re able to walk again; so that’s something to be happy about.”

“This couldn’t have come at a worse time, Dad.” Turning around, I leaned against the bathroom sink and said, “Kat and I were about to become a couple.”

“I see; and what brought this on?”

“Apparently she’s had a crush on me for the last couple years; she never did anything because of the age difference.” Sighing, I said, “She was so excited that we were the same age; but now, I’m even older than I was before this.”

“I’m sorry to hear that, son.” Looking at me, he said, “Although, to be honest, I’m not sure you two dating would’ve been the most appropriate decision.”

“Why not?”

“Because you two were practically siblings.” Taking a breath, Dad said, “God forbid something happened and you two broke up; what if you two couldn’t be in the same room anymore?”

As I leaned against the sink, I realized Dad was right. I couldn’t live with myself if I damaged my friendship with Kat. “I suppose you’re right, Dad; I just hope she sees it that way.”

“I suspect you’ll have plenty of time to figure out how to tell her.”

Dad and I walked out of the bathroom after that, and immediately realized that Dad was wrong. As soon as I stepped out of the bathroom, I saw Kat walk into the room.
111111111111411.title: Talking With Dad

1111111111114112.content:
I wish I could say that I was ready to face this new challenge: explaining to Kat about are new circumstances. Afterall, I was technically a man at this point. But I wasn't ready by a long shot. I pulled Dad back into the bathroom and had a bit of a breakdown.

"You okay son?" My dad asked with a raised eyebrow.

"There is just too much going on. I'm not ready to face Kat yet. I haven't processed it myself, nevermind trying to explain it to someone else."

My dad gave me a stern, yet understanding look. "I know this is a lot son, but you are going to have to face it. You can't hide this."

I ran my hands through my hair frantically and took a deep breathe. "I know Dad. I will face it. I will have a serious face-to-face conversation with Kat. But I literally found out all this today. I just need some time alone to really come to terms with is all. Just tell her that I will catch up with her tomorrow. Please Dad, I just need some time to adjust."

Dad studied me for a while. "If you are sure I can take care of it. But are you okay son? Really ok?"

I wanted to immediately answer yes. But I paused and really thought about it. Was I ok? I was fully prepared to spend the next few years re-doing my high school years. Now I was old enough to be past college. Once again my would was being turned upside down. Just like all those years ago when I woke in a hospital room to find out I was paralyzed. At least this time, the changes were a consequence of my choices. I have made it through a lot. I could walk now at least. I would be ok. I had made it through worse. I looked him in the eyes (which were on my level now), and replied shakily, "Yes I am...or rather will be ok. I just need.." My voice trailed off. I didn't know what I needed.

"Ok" Dad left to break the break the news to Kat.

I leaned against the bathroom door and slumped down to the floor. Through the door I could hear my dad talking to Kat. I heard him tell her that there were some complications. Yes I was ok but I needed some time. While Kat's voice was too soft for me to make out her words. I could tell that she was upset. I hated the fact that she was upset. A part of me wanted to go to her. To comfort her like I have done so many times before. Times when she got in trouble or was having problems with friends. What was I going to say to her. No I couldn't think about that right now.

I heard the door open and close. Then I heard my dad's voice "Son she's gone now. She said she would wait on your call and to let you know she was here for you. Do you want me to hang around or leave you alone?
1111111111114112.title: Something Else

111111111112.content:
Looking at my reflection in the mirror, I instantly noticed that I had shrunk almost two inches since yesterday. Okay, that’s weird. As I stood there, staring at the mirror, I tried to explain what I was seeing. The only logical explanation I could think of was that the serum was returning me to my original 13-year-old height.

As I sat on the toilet, relishing the fact that I was doing it on my own, I wondered whether or not I should tell someone about this. Dr. Sheppard had mentioned there would likely be some unknown side effects from the serum, perhaps this was one of them. If Dr. Sheppard was hoping to make this procedure readily available, he deserved to know if there was something happening to me.

So, after using the toilet, I made my way back to bed. Once I was sitting in bed, I reached over and grabbed the call button. An unfamiliar nurse walked into the room a few minutes later. “Is something wrong, Marcus?”

“Can you have Dr. Sheppard called to my room?” pausing, I said, “I think I’m experiencing a side effect from his serum.”

***********************


As it turned out, calling Dr. Sheppard turned out to be a good thing. He was as baffled as I was about what was happening. He called my folks back to the hospital; by which time I’d shrunk another three inches, making me the same height as a typical 11-year-old.

Dad was understandably upset that something like this was happening; after all, Dr. Sheppard assured us there’d be no complications. Glenn was worried as well; afraid of what else might happen to me. To her credit, Mom was doing a great job of keeping it together; although I could tell she was an emotional wreck.

“Do you think Dr. Sheppard will be able to fix this?” a worried look on my face, I said, “If I get any shorter people will think I’m a little kid.”

“Don’t you think like that, Marcus; I’m sure Dr. Sheppard will be able to fix this.” Taking my hand, Mom said, “In the meantime, just be grateful that the procedure had its intended effect.”

Dr. Sheppard walked into the room a few minutes later; a tablet in his hand and a grim look on his face. The look told me that he didn’t have good news. “What’s wrong with me, Doc?”

“It seems that the series of injections had an unintended side effect.” Looking at me and my family, Dr. Sheppard said, “It did repair Marcus’ spine as planned; but instead of making him a 13-year-old again, it’s making him even younger.”
Everyone in the room made an audible gasp. Looking at Dr. Sheppard, worried, I said, “How much younger?”

“If my tests are correct; by this time tomorrow, you’ll be _____.”
111111111112.title: A Few Inches Shorter

12.content:
Main Characters:
Marcus Scott – Formerly an 18-year-old boy; an experimental cure for his paralysis caused unforeseen side effects.
Kat Maddox – 13-year-old girl; lives next door to Marcus and his family. A close friend of Marcus, she’s had a crush on him for several years. She’s a new member of the High School Cheer squad.
Glenn Scott – Almost 15 years old; was Marcus’ younger brother, he’s now the older brother. He is grateful to no longer have to help Marcus in the bathroom.

Secondary Characters:

Kent & Gloria Scott – Marcus and Glenn’s parents.
Mr. & Mrs. Maddox – Kat’s parents
Eric Williams – 18 years old; a childhood friend of Marcus.
Allison Park – ICU nurse and family friend. Recently engaged to her girlfriend Jamie.
Dr. Kevin Sheppard – The doctor who created the serum used to cure Marcus.
